_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 12:03:45 using v2.1
title: Did people feel they were given enough time to discuss their condition and treatment?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of people who felt they had enough time to discuss their condition or treatment has been at least 90% every year. There has been no change in the proportion of people who felt they did not have enough time to discuss their condition (9%), but there has been a decrease in the number of people who felt they 'definitely' has enough time, from 70% in 2013 to 66% in 2014.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
